name: Delta Bow Valley

reviews.text: Can't complain too much. The hotel has been nicely updated. All rooms have nice comfy beds. Nice flat screen TVs. A plus is the min fridge that can be used to store your own juice/beverage/cream etc. If I can suggest, the gym needs a makeover, some equipments should be replaced, and the layout is awkward.
reviews.title: nice room and friendly service

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is good, but not the best (I believe Hyatt Regency is much better). It's kind of on the edge of the downtown core. It's just a block from Chinatown, so it's good if you want to have a cheap meal. However, it's a 10-min walk to the main entertainment area.
reviews.title: Nice Place to Return to After a Long Day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was in Calgary for a two day conference at the BMO Center. The conference had suggested the Hyatt Regency and Hotel Arts, however the Hyatt was too expensive and the Hotel Arts did not receive the greatest reviews. So I booked a stay with the Delta Bow Valley based on reviews on TA. Overall, my two nights at the Delta was very pleasant. Quick check in. Rooms were spacious and modern. The beds were very comfortable. Lots of counterspace in the bathroom and a nice shower head. Location was ideal, just a couple of blocks away from the c-train. Walking distance to 17th avenue where there are plenty of restaurants and some shopping. Underground parking charge is expensive but the norm for Calgary. I would stay here again. It would be great if they could get a starbucks at the bottom of the hotel and they should look into getting wireless internet access in the room!
reviews.title: We liked the location and the staff was friendly

reviews.text: We were in Calgary for a concert at the saddledome and wanted something close for accomodation. This is our first stay at the Delta chain and it was OK, the location was great and the staff was friendly, the room was average and looked worn but the bed was comfy. We were a bit put off by all the dirty room service trays on the way to our room and the fact that they sat there for 4 hrs, if you are paying $180 a night you shouldn't need to fight through old fries and ketchup to get to your room.
reviews.title: Inconsistent

reviews.text: We only used the resturant for breakfast, staff was wonderful, buffet was horrible.
reviews.title: Pleasant Hotel, central location, good facilities

reviews.text: LOVE this place beds are super cozy....I like that u can't get off the main floor without your room key. Undergound parking costs $12 though ugh lol...I hate paying for parking when your already paying a hotel bill but whatever over all i would totally stay here again !!
reviews.title: Just the right feel...clean , modern , class .....even smells nice :o)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a final stop on a road trip in Alberta but we hadn't booked anywhere in Calgary. We went past the hotel and as we know the chain we thought that it would be to an acceptable standard. The hotel has a nice lobby bar and the room was a pretty standard room. For the money I would think it was slightly overpriced but then we paid the rack rate and then with parking on-top it was not the cheapest. However the biggest problem was the lack of restaurants or anything to do within walking distance of the hotel. Maybe it was just that we were there on a Sunday night and because it is more a business district that was why everything was shut.
reviews.title: Not bad hotel but not much to do close by

reviews.text: Overall this hotel is everything you would expect from Delta (or any other big chain), you just may have to drive to find something to do on a weekend.
reviews.title: Delta Bow Valley
My whole staff enjoyed the stay as did I :)
reviews.text: We stayed in the Delta Bow for the last three nights of our trip to Canada. We arrived at the hotel in the afternoon and after what appeared to be some mix up with our booking were offered an upgrade to a one bedroom suite for free. Our room was on the 14th floor and overlooked the Calgary Tower awesome! The room was clean but a little tired and this extended to the lift and pool areas. Downtown Calgary where the hotel is situated is a little run down but seems to be going through some sort of re-development. We felt free to walk outside the hotel at night and didn't feel threatened at all. The hotel staff were very friendly and were helpful in booking taxis and giving directions. We would stay here again for a short stay if visiting Calgary.

Travel alot for Business and we use the Delta Chains across Canada. This Delta is tops in customer service and truly every stay is a pleasent one even when waking up at 4 AM for the start of another work day. They have complimentary coffee, teas and water to nudge you into your work day.
reviews.title: conveniently located, perfect quality/price ratio

description: Ideally located at the gateway to the business district, the Delta Bow Valley is renowned for genuine hospitality that’s “Straight from the Heart”. The Delta Bow Valley is first class at it’s finest with a flair of urban sophistication and comforts of home to make your stay enjoyable.Conveniently close to Calgary’s cultural district, Stampede Park, Telus Convention Centre, and Stephen Avenue shopping. Easy access to public transportation to explore all Calgary has to offer.
